docs.lead_paragraph: Automatic federal budget cuts are playing havoc with emergency unemployment benefits.

headline.seo: Unemployment Benefits Are Cut for Some New Yorkers
headline.main: New Yorkers Brace for Cuts in Unemployment Benefits
headline.print_headline: New Yorkers Brace for Cuts in Unemployment Benefits

docs.abstract: Benefits for more than 140,000 New York State residents who have been unemployed for more than six months are to be cut by almost 11 percent as a result of budget stalemate in Washington; New York is one of the first states to carry out the automatic federal budget cuts, known as sequestration, mandating an $85 billion across-the-board reduction in spending on military and domestic programs.
docs.snippet: Automatic federal budget cuts are playing havoc with emergency unemployment benefits.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal agency said blindness and death risks were not properly communicated to parents, depriving them of information when deciding whether to participate.

headline.main: Study of Babies Did Not Disclose Risks, U.S. Finds
headline.print_headline: Study of Babies Did Not Disclose Risks, U.S. Finds

docs.abstract: Office for Human Research Protections finds that 23 prestigious universities failed to inform families of possible fatal side effects in government-financed study involving extremely premature babies; says researchers neglected to communicate to more than a thousand families that risks included increased chances of blindness or death, depriving parents of information when deciding whether to participate with their infants.
docs.snippet: A federal agency said blindness and death risks were not properly communicated to parents, depriving them of information when deciding whether to participate.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama’s gamble in making concessions to Republicans on Medicare and Social Security drew anger from those to his left. But others in his party see such changes as necessary.

headline.seo: Obama Budget Seeks Deal in Mix of Cuts and Spending
headline.main: Obama Budget Opens Rift for Democrats on Social Benefits
headline.print_headline: Obama Budget Whittles Democratic Party Pillars

docs.abstract: Pres Obama's new budget proposes concessions to Republicans on Social Security and Medicare in exchange for higher taxes on wealthy and spending to create jobs; Obama's offer to compromise on social programs opens heated debate among Democrats over what it means to be progressive in an age of austerity.
docs.snippet: President Obama’s gamble in making concessions to Republicans on Medicare and Social Security drew anger from those to his left. But others in his party see such changes as necessary.

docs.abstract: Many people believe that evening exercise will undermine sleep, but there’s little scientific evidence to support that idea, especially if the activity isn’t too taxing.
docs.snippet: Many people believe that evening exercise will undermine sleep, but there’s little scientific evidence to support that idea, especially if the activity isn’t too taxing.
